archdesc.bioghist: Horace (Bill) Dewey (University of Michigan BA 1942, MA 1948, JD 1950, PhD 1955) taught a variety of courses in Russian language and literature at the University of Michgian, specializing in Old Russian and 18th Century literature. He also conducted research and taught courses on Russian history, focusing on the legal structures and institutions of Russia before the reign of Peter the Great, and the impact these institutions had on the lives of Russian people. Ann Kleimola is professor of History at the University of Nebraska-Licoln who focuses on Russian society and culture.
archdesc.scopecontent: Collection includes manuscripts of Horace (Bill) Dewey and Ann Kleimola relating to early Russian history: "The Story of Poruka: Suretyship and Collective Responsibility in Pre-Petrine Russia" and English translations of surety bonds, 15th and 16th centuries.
